lead_paragraph: Representatives of the opposition have refused to come to the table until the besieged towns are given a reprieve and bombings of civilians are halted.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting.
byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ANNE BARNARD

snippet: Representatives of the opposition have refused to come to the table until the besieged towns are given a reprieve and bombings of civilians are halted.

headline.main: Besieged Syria Towns Emerge as Crucial Sticking Point in Talks
headline.print_headline: Besieged Towns Emerge as a Crucial Sticking Point

abstract: High Negotiations Committee, coalition of Syrian rebel groups meant to participate in Geneva peace talks, refuses to take part until Syrian government ends sieges of rebel-held towns; group's demands and government's failure to participate in meaningful way on first day of talks sets expectations low, with some viewing lifting of government sieges on towns as best possible outcome.
